meanings.definition: A person who is drowsy or inclined to sleep.
meanings.sent1: The sleepyheads in the class struggled to keep their eyes open during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, the sleepyheads gathered in the living room to relax.
meanings.sent3: The sleepyheads at the slumber party couldn't resist the temptation of a midnight snack.
meanings.sent4: The cozy library was filled with sleepyheads lost in dreamland among the books.
meanings.sent5: The sleepyheads on the train dozed off to the rhythmic sound of the tracks.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are tired and ready for bed.
meanings.sent1: The children at the sleepover were all sleepyheads by 10 pm, eager to crawl into their sleeping bags.
meanings.sent2: As the night grew darker, the sleepyheads in the campsite slowly made their way to their tents.
meanings.sent3: The sleepyheads at the slumber party giggled as they tried to stay awake for the scary movie marathon.
meanings.sent4: The sleepyheads in the hotel lobby yawned in unison, waiting for the elevator to take them to their rooms.
meanings.sent5: The sleepyheads around the campfire shared stories before drifting off to sleep under the starry sky.
